page.title: 14Trade
page.content: There are many small businesses (see employment) During early 1985 a new supermarket at Scotstoun near the M9. it was a controversial issue.There is no large store at present in S.Queensferry.At public meetings local people welcomed competitive prices and greater varieties of goods without having to travel into large towns. There would be employment for 300 people in the store,garden centre,bowling alley etc which was planned.14 local shop keepers were interviewed.8 were against and 6 were for the supermarket.Those against felt that the rural landscape would be spoiled.They also feared that loss of trade would mean the inability to pay the new high increase in rates.
